polityTypes.name: Sovereign Empire
polityTypes.description: A fully independent state controlling territory.

polityTypes.name: Megacorporation
polityTypes.description: A commercial entity spanning multiple systems.

polityTypes.name: Federation
polityTypes.description: A multi-state federation sharing sovereignty under a common charter.

polityTypes.name: Theocracy
polityTypes.description: Ruled directly by religious authorities or bound by a divine mandate.

polityTypes.name: Rebel Faction
polityTypes.description: An insurgent organization contesting established authority.

polityTypes.name: City-State
polityTypes.description: A single metropolitan polity with autonomy often built around a core city.

polityTypes.name: NGO / Order
polityTypes.description: A non-governmental organization or religious order.

polityTypes.name: Vassal State
polityTypes.description: A state subservient to a higher power.

polityTypes.name: Shadow Kabal
polityTypes.description: A secretive group pulling strings from the dark.

polityTypes.name: Colony
polityTypes.description: A polity established as an outpost of another power with limited autonomy.

civics.name: Socialist
civics.description: Collective ownership and state-led distribution of resources.

civics.name: Isolationist
civics.description: Minimizes external contact and foreign entanglements.

civics.name: Trader Guilds
civics.description: The economy is dominated by merchant interests and guilds.

civics.name: Authoritarian
civics.description: Centralized power concentrated in a single authority or ruling class.

civics.name: Religious Rule
civics.description: Religious doctrine defines laws and governance.

civics.name: Plutocracy
civics.description: Rule by the wealthy where economic power drives political influence.

civics.name: Democratic
civics.description: Governance through elected representatives and popular participation.

civics.name: Corporate Rule
civics.description: Corporations control major aspects of society and governance.
